intro: Cassipourea paludosa, commonly known as the swamp cassipourea, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Cassipourea paludosa is often found in lowland areas and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
